de.lessvoid.coregl

Class CoreShader

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lessvoid.coregl.CoreShader

  • public class CoreShader
extends Object
    Helper class that represents a shader (actually the combination of a vertex and a fragment shader - what GL actually calls a program).
    Author:
    void, Brian Groenke (groenke.5@osu.edu)

    • Method Detail

      • createShader

        public static CoreShader createShader(CoreGL gl)
        Create a new Shader.
        Returns:
        the new CoreShader instance

      • createShaderWithVertexAttributes

        public static CoreShader createShaderWithVertexAttributes(CoreGL gl,
                                                          String... vertexAttributes)
        Create a new Shader with the given vertex attributes automatically bind to the generic attribute indices in ascending order beginning with 0. This method can be used when you want to control the vertex attribute binding on your own.
        Parameters:
        vertexAttributes - the name of the vertex attribute. The first String gets generic attribute index 0. the second String gets generic attribute index 1 and so on.
        Returns:
        the CoreShader instance

        public void setUniformMatrix(String name,
                             int componentNum,
                             FloatBuffer values)
        Set uniform matrix of dimension 'n x n' where n = componentNum
        Parameters:
        name - name of the GLSL uniform variable
        componentNum - matrix dimension 'n'
        values -

      • setUniformMatrix

        public void setUniformMatrix(String name,
                             int n,
                             int m,
                             FloatBuffer values)
        Set a uniform matrix of dimension 'n x m'.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the GLSL uniform variable
        n - number of columns in the matrix
        m - number of rows in the matrix
        values -
